Delhi

May 28, 2008

The flight from New York was easy. I slept most of the way. I got to Delhi and took a cab to a friend’s place in Defense Colony. My plan was to leave this morning for Darjeeling. Some friendly face, Scottish whiskey, and a dependable offer to drive me to the airline’s office in the morning to change my flight (fee of only $15) is enough to have me here until Sunday next Friday. I can feel New York’s pace slogging off of me as summer starts in earnest.
